comment: You get 4 grades in the class and one of those grades is attendance. We watch videos and movies mostly. For the entire first half of the semester, she was late daily and canceled classes with short notice or no notice. She is factual and will make you think, but doesn't always respect opinions that don't align with her. Easy A if you attend class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The best teacher I've ever had. Would easily take this class again. She is very knowledgeable and really changed my perspectives on how I see the world. No tests. A few papers. Grades pretty fairly as long as you follow the rubric. Don't skip class (for grade purposes), but her class is so interesting you really won't even want to!
She is great. The course is very eye opening and pushes you to grow. The class is not boring. There are no tests just 3 papers.

She is a great professor. She makes sure all of her students learn a lot. Her lectures are amazing and are really eye-opening. There are only three papers, and if you follow the prompt, it is easy to do well. Attendance is a grade, so show up!

I really enjoyed her class. She knows her stuff. There are times where you will feel uncomfortable, but she says on the first day that's the whole point of the class. She gives you 3 major assignments. Attendance is a big part of your grade, so don't miss class unless you absolutely cannot make it. I would recommend her 100%.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: I LOVE this professor. TAKE HER. She is the most amazing education professor i have ever had. Coming from a white person, I LOVED HER. EASY EASY A as long as you complete her homework assignments and come to all her classes! She is an amazing lecturer! Any negative rating on here is because they did not complete an easy assignment/show up to class.

Professor Ward is a great professor and is very passionate about what she teaches. This can serve as a bit of a drawback sometimes because you may have opposing viewpoints to hers. Overall, I'd say take her.

Dr. Ward is a really good teacher but she's very passionate about her subject which sometimes was very annoying if you had a different viewpoint. You can get an A if you just do the assignments. Class discussions sometimes will make you uncomfortable but thats the point.  I would recommend her.

She is one of the best professors I have ever had. She does a really good job of opening your eyes to issues and such without forcing radical opinions on you. She always says, "If you don't get uncomfortable at least once in my class, you aren't learning anything." I 100% recommend taking her.

the class is pretty straightforward, there are 4 assignments all which she gives very clear instructions on how to complete. she's not a tough grader, she's very nice and you can tell she is passionate about the subject matter. class discussions made it uncomfortable but that is the point of her class. very easy and good A because you learn a lot

Professor Ward is AMAZING and this was the best course I've ever taken. There is a strict attendance policy, but the class is so great you won't want to miss. There's 3 papers, a presentation, your attendance grade, and 15 hours of community service (if you don't do the hours, you fail the course automatically). Not the easiest class, but worth it!

This class is all about getting you out of your comfort zone and learning about diversity and privilege. Professor is respectful, while still being open. No tests, but many papers/presentations. Have to read a novel in addition to textbook. 15 hours of volunteer work is required. Very interesting class, if I could take it again, I would.

Dr. Ward really cares about what she teaches. She is teaching about diversity and wants you to really understand. Not a lot of grades other than attendance so make your work count. Field Experience of 15 hours required through VKSU. Must complete FE by date in syllabus otherwise it is an automatic fail. Class is deep and intense but interesting.

She is an amazing teacher. Simply put. Takes attendance but the class is most definitely worth going to. Everyday is a good day to go to class. She does not shy away from sensitive topics, but she is never disrespectful. If you can, take her class.

Dr. Ward presents very sensitive subject matter professionally and tactfully.   She inspired me to "lean into" (her words) areas that were not necessarily easy topics to explore or discuss.  As a future educator, I believe she guided me very well in preparing for the classroom.

TAKE HER! Great lecturer and as long as you go to class and write the 3 long papers (1: 3-5 page, 1: 5-8 page, and 1: 8-10 page) you will get an A or B. She does take attendance and attendance is 25% of your grade and those other papers are the other 75%. Learned a lot!!!

I think it was Dr. Ward that made EDUC 2120 a great class for me. She is SO passionate about the subject, which is wonderful. No tests. Easy A but only if you write the 3 required papers, following her requirements. Attendance is mandatory - the grade for it counts a lot. Interesting, relatable lectures and subject matter. Very eye-opening class.

Amazing teacher. Class is interesting and enjoyable every day. No tests, 3 papers throughout the semester which aren't bad. Attendance counts a lot. She is an inspiring person and tells stories that are always interesting. I learned so much from her class she really is amazing.

Dr. Ward is an amazing instructor. She has a way of explaining material that makes it interesting, but also hits home and is easy to comprehend. Group work, but it's fun as by the end of the semester you know your classmates well. Her classes are a lot of work, but rewarding and easily passed. Excellent professor overall, real quality and genuine.

If you hate writing papers & have a heavy semester load, don't take her. Great lectures, no tests at all(midterms or finals). Two 5 page papers(midterm & volunteer assignment) and one 10 page(final) instead. Easy A if you don't mind writing. Attendance counts.
